TLSEngine

EventDispatcher
TLSEngine

The heart of the TLS protocol.  This class can work in server or client mode.  This doesn’t fully implement the TLS protocol.  Things missing that I’d like to add: - support for client-side certificates - general code clean-up to make sure we don’t have gaping securite holes Things that aren’t there that I won’t add: - support for “export” cypher suites (deprecated in later TLS versions) - support for “anon” cypher suites (deprecated in later TLS versions) Things that I’m unsure about adding later: - compression.  Compressing encrypted streams is barely worth the CPU cycles.  - diffie-hellman based key exchange mechanisms.  Nifty, but would we miss it?

Author

henri

Functions

TLSEngine

function TLSEngine(config: TLSConfig,  
iStream: IDataInput,  
oStream: IDataOutput,  
otherIdentity: String = null)

Parameters

configA TLSConfig instance describing how we’re supposed to work
iStreamAn input stream to read TLS data from
oStreamAn output stream to write TLS data to
otherIdentityAn optional identifier.  If set, this will be checked against the Subject CN of the other side’s certificate. 

start

public function start():void

This starts the TLS negotiation for a TLS Client.

This is a no-op for a TLS Server.

dataAvailable

public function dataAvailable(e: * = null):void

Functions

startHandshake

private function startHandshake():void

The handshake is always started by the client.

parseHandshake

private function parseHandshake(p: ByteArray):ByteArray

Handle the incoming handshake packet.

notifyStateError

private function notifyStateError(rec: ByteArray) : void

Throw an error when the detected handshake state isn’t a valid state for the given entity type (client vs. server, etc.  ). This really should abort the handshake, since there’s no case in which a server should EVER be confused about the type of entity it is.  BP

parseClientKeyExchange

private function parseClientKeyExchange(rec: ByteArray) : void

two unimplemented functions

parseServerKeyExchange

private function parseServerKeyExchange(rec: ByteArray) : void

verifyHandshake

private function verifyHandshake(rec: ByteArray):void

Test the server’s Finished message for validity against the data we know about.  Only slightly rewritten.  BP

loadCertificates

private function loadCertificates(rec: ByteArray):void

Vaguely gross function that parses a RSA key out of a certificate.

As long as that certificate looks just the way we expect it to.
